instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 3437 Very Slow
threads.message: Got a 820-3437 that powers on and boots up. It has full fan spin and is very slow. All temp sensors show normal in mac fan control. I have replaced the trackpad and flex which didn't fix issue. no signs of corrosion or water damage.  The only thing abnormal was a loose screw around c7323.  s5 hs computing is reading normal in diode mode .141 so i don't think that caused any damage.

threads.title: 3437 Very Slow
threads.message:
First, do PRAM reset.
Try another LIO board/flex.
Also try disconnecting webcam.
Run ASD EFI version and report any error.

threads.title: 3437 Very Slow
threads.message:
[URL="https://imgur.com/a/opabYsL"]https://imgur.com/a/opabYsL

looks like it has cpu sensor, air flow and camera sensor bad[/URL]

threads.title: 3437 Very Slow
threads.message: yes i did.  I replaced the logic board with an all good board and everything is working fine.  so i know all parts are good.

threads.title: 3437 Very Slow
threads.message:
Seems to have a problem on SMC S0 "1" SMBus.
Check R5360/61 first.
Also check solders and traces around U5800.
Be sure to have good connections to its temp sensors.

threads.title: 3437 Very Slow
threads.message: trace seems to be fine in diode mode and resistors are reading 1.9k  i reballed u5800 connections and resistors to be sure.  getting same errors.  should i replace u5800?

threads.title: 3437 Very Slow
threads.message:
"Be sure to have good connections to its temp sensors."
I mean  to Q5810/30/60...

threads.title: 3437 Very Slow
threads.message:
so i found a short on c5811 and traced it back to u5800.  replaced it and now its passing asd.

thanks for the help!
